channel.title: Fail headphones are fail?
channel.description:
Kai well, recently i bought some plugz (about 3 months ago) within 3 weeks at the top of the jack i guess it bent the wire internally and now only plays out of one plug (garbage) (now plays out of none)
So i bought another pair of plugs, this time a better version of the previous, same thing happened.
and just this month i decided to switch brands, JVC, and the same thing happened in a month.
The first brand btw was Earpollution.
My question is, what cheap pair of plugs can i get that have GOOD DURABILITY, and somewhat decent sound quality. my budget is $40 for plugs sadly...

item.title: Fail headphones are fail?
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

[quote="`Lewk_, post:29, topic:316143"][quote author=Cheese_Police link=topic=412721.msg3048072#msg3048072 date=1259898843]

But iPod headphones are shit =P

fuck off, you’re retarded

too bad he’s right
[/quote]
Not really, iPod headphones have lasted me the longest out of any others, they won’t break if you don’t treat them like shit.[/quote]

I’m not talking about the durability though, mine have lasted my about six years. I’m saying they sound bad, even my dad’s which are pretty much new.

Read full topic

item.title: Fail headphones are fail?
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

bootnecklad:

I never treated mine like shit I had them for a few days (~3) and the left speaker borked, I kept using it for in class and then the wire next to the jack borked itself.

I’ve had the same pair for 3 years.

Read full topic

item.title: Fail headphones are fail?
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

But iPod headphones are shit =P

They have lasted me since the sixth grade with my first iPod nano (that was like five or six years ago), but they don’t even compare in sound quality compared to some AKG earbuds or head direct RE0’s.

item.title: Fail headphones are fail?

item.title: Fail headphones are fail?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

My $20AUD Sony headphones last for ages. Usually months or years. And that’s not just now, either – that includes the time I spent in high school, where I’d listen to them for at least half hour on buses each day, lunch times, and in class (when I could get away with it).

If you treat them like a 2 year old would treat something then no, they’re not going to last.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

I found out that… for my iphone headphones anyway, when the sound went in one ear… If i Hit that earphone against a wall it started working again

item.title: Fail headphones are fail?
item.dc:creator: @grantbm grantbm
item.description:
@grantbm wrote:

I have had pair of Panasonic RP-HTX7PP for about 3 years and they are just now starting to break. They are over all have good sound quality and they are durable. And they are not that expensive.

amazon.com

Amazon.com: Panasonic RP-HTX7PP-W Retro Style Monitor Headphones (White) (Discontinued by Manufacturer): Home Audio & Theater

Panasonic RP-HTX7PP-W Old School Monitor Headphones (White)

item.title: Fail headphones are fail?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:15, topic:316143”][quote author=`Lewk_ link=topic=412721.msg3044635#msg3044635 date=1259378104]
To be honest, I suggest buying crappy headphones for like 6$ or something. No matter how expensive they are, they are still going to break. So save yourself some money and buy shitty ones. Plus, even if their <$70 they’ll break just as fast as ones you can get for $6.
[/quote]I like listening to rusty pipes with water dripping in them as well, great idea![/quote]
Agree, shit phones sound like shit. (ie, iPod buds).

Read full topic

item.title: Fail headphones are fail?
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

Yeah, I heard just about anything from Sennheiser is good.

@Lewk: Thats not necessarily true. I lost just about every phone I had until I paid for a good one. Makes a person put more value into it. And, aside from the morals debate, look at this picture: http://head-direct.com/upload/2009Jun28095518RE0-5.jpg See the cord protection? 80 dollars and that is one damn good cord, won’t get that on a 6$ headphone.

Read full topic
